name: URLs to XML document
description: Fetches HTML from URLs, parses it, and converts to a simplified XML format. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

search_results.name: search_results
search_results.info: List of retrieved URLs from a search engine to convert to XML

code.value:
import requests
from loguru import logger
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from xml.etree.ElementTree import Element, SubElement, tostring
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, Output
from xml.dom.minidom import parse, parseString

class URLsToXMLConverter(Component):
    display_name = "URLs to XML Converter"
    description = "Fetches HTML from URLs, parses it, and converts to a simplified XML format."
    icon = "file-code"
    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="search_results",
            display_name="Results from search, with URLs",
            info="List of retrieved URLs from a search engine to convert to XML",
            
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="XML Output", name="xml_output", method="process_urls"),
    ]

    def html_to_xml(self, soup):
        def create_element(tag):
            element = Element(tag.name)
            for attr, value in tag.attrs.items():
                element.set(attr, str(value))
            for child in tag.children:
                if child.name is not None:
                    element.append(create_element(child))
                elif isinstance(child, str) and child.strip():
                    element.text = child.strip()
            return element

        root = Element("document")
        for tag in soup.body.children:
            if tag.name is not None:
                root.append(create_element(tag))
        return root

    def process_urls(self) -> Data:
        search_results: List[Data] = self.search_results
        processed_urls = []

        for result in search_results:
            url = result.link
            new_item = result.data.copy()

            try:
                # 1. Extract HTML from the response
                response = requests.get(url)
                html_content = response.text

                # 2. Parse the HTML
                soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser')
                logger.debug(f"Parsed HTML for URL: {url}")

                # 3. Convert the document to XML Format
                xml_root = self.html_to_xml(soup)
                xml_string = parseString(tostring(xml_root)).toprettyxml(indent="  ")
                logger.debug(f"Converted to XML for URL: {url}")

                new_item["markdown"] = xml_string
                processed_urls.append(Data(data=new_item))
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Error processing URL {url}: {str(e)}")
                raise


        # self.status = f"Processed {len(processed_urls)}/{len(search_results)} URLs"
        return processed_urls

import requests
from loguru import logger
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
from xml.etree.ElementTree import Element, SubElement, tostring
from axiestudio.schema import Data
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.io import DataInput, Output
from xml.dom.minidom import parse, parseString

class URLsToXMLConverter(Component):
    display_name = "URLs to XML Converter"
    description = "Fetches HTML from URLs, parses it, and converts to a simplified XML format."
    icon = "file-code"
    inputs = [
        DataInput(
            name="search_results",
            display_name="Results from search, with URLs",
            info="List of retrieved URLs from a search engine to convert to XML",
            
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="XML Output", name="xml_output", method="process_urls"),
    ]

    def html_to_xml(self, soup):
        def create_element(tag):
            element = Element(tag.name)
            for attr, value in tag.attrs.items():
                element.set(attr, str(value))
            for child in tag.children:
                if child.name is not None:
                    element.append(create_element(child))
                elif isinstance(child, str) and child.strip():
                    element.text = child.strip()
            return element

        root = Element("document")
        for tag in soup.body.children:
            if tag.name is not None:
                root.append(create_element(tag))
        return root

    def process_urls(self) -> Data:
        search_results: List[Data] = self.search_results
        processed_urls = []

        for result in search_results:
            url = result.link
            new_item = result.data.copy()

            try:
                # 1. Extract HTML from the response
                response = requests.get(url)
                html_content = response.text

                # 2. Parse the HTML
                soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser')
                logger.debug(f"Parsed HTML for URL: {url}")

                # 3. Convert the document to XML Format
                xml_root = self.html_to_xml(soup)
                xml_string = parseString(tostring(xml_root)).toprettyxml(indent="  ")
                logger.debug(f"Converted to XML for URL: {url}")

                new_item["markdown"] = xml_string
                processed_urls.append(Data(data=new_item))
            except Exception as e:
                logger.error(f"Error processing URL {url}: {str(e)}")
                raise


        # self.status = f"Processed {len(processed_urls)}/{len(search_results)} URLs"
        return processed_urls
